intro: Mischocarpus pyriformis subsp. pyriformis, commonly known as the round-fruit spondias, is a deciduous tree native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by edible, round, orange fruits that are typically harvested when fully mature. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for both ecological and horticultural purposes.
